page.title: 14JOINERY/SCHOOL TRANSPORT
page.content: At{Whincups}joinery there are six machines.The building is twenty years old. They make things like 4 poster beds,door handles,table legs and plungers.{Mr.Whincup}employs 3 people. The furthest they have delivered is Birmingham and London .They mostly sell plungers and door knobs.The two brothers started the business together The wood comes from Germany,Sweden and Russia .The building has always been in the same spot.They give the shavings that are left over to horse stables. {Denis Conning}drives a mini-bus for the school transport service. He brings the children from two miles away to school and takes them back home.He also takes the older children to Knaresborough School.He used to deliver milk,but now his children who are grown-up do it instead.
